Value proposition: We have a clear and compelling value proposition that addresses our customers' most significant pains and needs
We have strong evidence showing direct link between value prop and the customer's willingness to pay
Our value proposition is differentiated from competitors
Business model: Our business model is clearly documented through a business canvas
We have identified and tested scalable revenue streams that can grow over time
We have a business model that will be financially sustainable (without subsidies)
Our business model is scalable (revenues increase faster than costs)
We have sufficient working capital to grow according to our ambition
Product leadership: We have a product leadership team that drives a clear vision and prioritization for our product roadmap
We actively use customer insights and feedback loops to inform product decisions and validate assumptions.
We run regular growth experiments and iterate quickly based on measurable outcomes
Our team uses lean startup methods to test and refine our product features before full-scale development
We have a clear process for identifying and prioritizing the features that deliver the most value to our customers
We continuously measure and evaluate to determine whether we have real product/market fit
Market leadership: Few deliver similar propositions as us
It is easy for our customers to choose us rather than our competitors
We are effectively gaining traction in our target market segments
It is difficult for others to enter the market (cheap, fast, easy)
It is difficult for existing competitors to copy our products

Customer portfolio: We have several returning (long term) customers
We are not dependent on one single customer
We actively refine customer retention strategies to minimize churn
Customer understanding: We have a good understanding of the value we create for our customers (pains & gains)
We have a good understanding of who is the decision-maker at our various customers
We have a good understanding of main customer decision-making process
Network: We have several good ambassadors for our product / service
We have established well functioning routines to maintain and strengthen our network
We have well functioning strategies for building our network
We have mapped out the ecosystem surrounding our customer
We have entered strategic partnerships with relevant players
Branding: We have a compelling and clear brand identity
Our logo and graphic profile reflects our brand identity
We are consciously building our brand
Communication and marketing: Our communication and marketing strategy is conceptualized/written out
We have an action plan for communication and marketing
We have a dynamic communication strategy that adapts to market and audience needs
We have chosen the most appropriate channels for our marketing efforts
We can clearly see that marketing efforts trigger sales
Sales: We follow up on all leads
We have dedicated resources working with sales
We are not dependent on external sales support
We have a good return on our sales efforts
We have good systems for sales training

Strategy and growth planning: We have a short-term plan with concrete actions (<1 year)
We use OKRs to reach our goals
We have a long-term strategy that is in line with our impact ambitions
The strategy is actively used in ongoing priorities and decisions
The strategy is updated regularly and as needed
The strategy is well rooted in the entire organization, including our board
Financial management: We have sufficient competence for financial management in our team
We continuously refine our pricing and value propositions to align with market needs
We have created an appropriate budget
We actively analyze financial data to inform and shape our growth strategy
Our management uses financial models or calculations as decision making support
Accounting: Our company has well-functioning accounting routines and follows good accounting practice
There is a clear distinction between our private finances and the company's finances
Our company has good routines for bookkeeping travel expenses and other expenses
Our company has board certified power of attorney for authorization and routines
We have clear financial structures and compliance practices that support sustainable growth
Financial results: We have a clear understanding of our cash runway and actively monitor it to make strategic decisions
We have realistic milestones and a plan to achieve financial sustainability within the next three years
We are actively experimenting to validate and grow predictable revenue sources
Financing: The company is well equipped to meet future investment needs as defined in company goals and strategy
The company does not operate at our creditor's expense (unable to meet current obligations)
The company is not in any debt negotiations with its creditors
Delivery management: Our company has good systems for delivering products / services
We have a predictable need for resources related to our deliveries
Our delivery is of high and consistent quality
We have good agreements with key suppliers for our deliveries
Core Technology: We have defined an architectural north star that guides our long-term technical development and scalability
Our technical team has the necessary expertise and capacity to deliver on our current and future product roadmap
We have established best practices and development processes to ensure high-quality, maintainable, and scalable code
We have a good idea of what tech talent we need to attract in the future, and a plan to do so

Legal: We have access to legal expertise when needed and use legal assistance when required
We proactively assess and address potential legal risks to ensure smooth operations
We have the legal rights to our business concept, product and/or service (freedom to operate)
Ownership structure: Our ownership structure is clean and aligns with the long-term vision and goals of the company
We have an ESOP plan to attract and incentivize key employees, advisors, and early supporters
Employees: We have a clear plan to scale our team and competencies as the business grows
We have mapped out our competence needs
Existing employees cover the need for competence
We have mapped future talent and competence needs
We have an employee brand strategy
Our employees have clear job descriptions and we are well covered to solve all key activities in the company
Our employment agreements satisfy the Working Environment Act
Management: The company has a clearly defined leader (and a management group)
Our management has a conscious relationship towards creating and preserving an appropriate culture in the company
Employee interviews/feedback sessions are conducted regularly
There is a good vibe among the founders and management team
Board: The board members are actively helping secure customers, capital, or talent
The board is actively used in the company's strategic work
We have insurance for our board members
We have a board calendar and an annual schedule for board meetings
The board consists of also independently elected representatives
Partnerships: We are conscious of how partnerships can strengthen our business
We have entered into important partnerships
Team: We have complementary skills within the team
We evaluate how we work together as a team
We work well together in solving challenges

Impact awareness: We have a clear understanding of what impact we want to have
We have reliable information/research which documents our problem to be solved
Impact measurement: Our company has a theory of change
We have a clear understanding of what we need to measure to maximize our impact
We have assessed the risks associated with our impact
Impact measurements are included in the company's operational routines
The company regularly reports impact results in board meetings
We communicate our positive impact actively in our webpage and pitch deck
We have knowledge about the SFDR regulations and Principal Adverse Impacts
Impact management: Our company has an impact management plan
Management are using impact results as decision support
We have mapped our impact results and objectives towards the UN's sustainability goals
Impact ambitions: The company achieves maximum impact value creation given the company's prerequisites as of today
The company has clear ambitions for future growth and maximization of impact results

Preparation & Documentation: Our dataroom is well-organized, including essential documents such as the pitch deck, contract, financial model, cap table, team bios, etc.
We have a clear and compelling pitch deck tailored to investors (value prop, market, growth plan)
We have a process in place to update our dataroom effectively
Our cap table is clean and structured, providing clarity on equity distribution and post-round dilution
Strategy & Targeting: We have identified and mapped potential investors who align with our stage, industry, and goals
We have a prioritized list of investors based on strategic fit and the value they can bring to the company
We have a clear understanding of the terms we are seeking, including valuation, equity offered, and deal structure
We have defined key milestones this fundraising round will help us achieve, and we can clearly communicate them
Team & Process: We have a dedicated team or individual responsible for managing the fundraising process
Our leadership team is aligned on the fundraising strategy, goals, and use of funds
We have rehearsed and refined our pitch to address potential investor questions and objections
We are prepared to handle due diligence requests quickly and professionally
We have a clear timeline and step-by-step plan for reaching out to investors, following up, and closing the round
Investor Relations: We actively nurture relationships with investors, even when not actively fundraising
We have a post-fundraising communication plan to keep investors informed of progress and milestones
We clearly understand the exit strategies available and can articulate them to investors
We seek feedback and mentorship from experienced founders or advisors to strengthen our fundraising approach
